ME Flossmoor Elevator Is Out Of Service
The Flossmoor elevator is out of service. Customers can use Calumet as alternate boarding station. Updates will be provided.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/UP-W?Twitter=0&Email=0&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
UPW Trains Delayed

UPW inbound and outbound trains may be operating 20 minutes to extensively delayed due to an earlier freight train striking a vehicle. Please listen to announcements for delay times and visit MetraTracker.com for the location of your train.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
ME Millennium Station Elevator
The Millennium Station elevator is out of service. Customers can use the Museum Campus or McCormick Place elevator as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
ME 147th Sibley Elevator Is Out Of Service
The 147th Street/Sibley elevator is out of service.  Customers can use 115th Street/Kensington or Harvey as alternate boarding stations.  Updates will be provided.

The Van Buren Street Station elevator is out of service Customers can use the Museum Campus or McCormick Place elevator as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.

UPW Train #33 - Platform Change

UPW outbound train #33, scheduled to arrive Elburn at 2:08 PM, will arrive and board from platform 1 at Bellwood, Berkley, Elmhurst and Villa Park. Safely make your way to platform 1 to board this train.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1

The Hazel Crest elevator is out of service. Customers can use Harvey or Calumet as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.

UPW #44 On the Move
UPW #44 scheduled to arrive Chicago at 12:20 PM, is on the move  delayed 45 to 50 minutes due to an earlier freight train striking a vehicle.

UPW 48 Delayed Departure
Train 48, scheduled to arrive Chicago at 1:50 p.m., will be a delayed departure due to an earlier freight train striking a vehicle. Delay times are unknown.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
ME Ground Level Boarding

ME All trains will ground load at 111th, 107th, 103rd, 95th, 91st, 87th, 83rd, 79th, and 75th Street. Please wait visible to the engineer, do not operate chains or gates in ground load areas, follow train crew's instructions after the train stops
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
ME Ivanhoe Elevator Is Out Of Service
The Ivanhoe elevator is out of service. Customers can use Harvey or 115th Street/Kensington as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric 103rd Station Closed - Full Reconstruction

As part of the Metra Electric Community Initiative to transform 13 stations on the district, the 103rd Street/Rosemoor station remains closed for a full reconstruction and is expected to reopen next spring. During this time, customers can use 107th Street and 95th Street/Chicago State University as alternatives. For additional information click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - 87th street/Woodruff Station Closure Beginning December 16 - Station Rebuild Project

The 87th street/Woodruff station on the Metra Electric line will be closed beginning Monday, December 16. During this time passengers can use 83rd and 91st street stations as alternatives. This is part of the Metra Electric Community initiative to transform multiple stations on the Metra Electric District. Once completed, the station will have an enclosed ADA-accessible street-level entrance, lobby with an elevator, new stairs, headhouses, new composite deck platforms, new lighting, and signage. The station is expected to reopen in late 2025. For more information visit metra.com.
